left.title: Sequence the genomes of your IVF embryos
left.content: For many hopeful parents facing infertility, in vitro fertilization (IVF) offers a chance at realizing their dream of having a child. Today, IVF success rates have climbed steadily higher with advances in technology and testing. At GenEmbryomics, we strive to take this progress a step further through our pre-implantation whole genome sequencing test, GenomeScreen®.

mid.content: Screen your embryos by unlocking /nthe power of the genome

right.title: Genetic diseases that affects Embrayo
right.content: While standard pre-implantation genetic testing (PGT) checks for major anomalies, it misses thousands of genetic variants that could cause debilitating diseases in future children.  Our test provides comprehensive information so parents can make truly empowered choices during IVF to give their future baby the healthiest start possible.

left.title:
Fertility specialist 
Believe about 
Embrayo
left.content: GenomeScreen® analyzes up to 98% of each embryo's genome, revealing mutations inherited from parents as well as de novo mutations that arise randomly during conception. This reveals risks for single-gene disorders, chromosomal abnormalities, and more. Our data shows 99.97% accuracy for inherited mutations and over 99% for de novo mutations, backed by rigorous performance metrics.

right.title:
How to make IVF
Free from genetic
diseases
right.content: At GenEmbryomics, we understand infertility and the IVF journey can be difficult enough without added worries. Our goal is to support hopeful parents and their providers throughout with the most accurate and actionable genome information, enabling choices guided by deeper understanding and greater confidence. From collection to analysis to results, our GenomeScreen® service strives to bring peace of mind as parents welcome their newest family member into the world.

left.title:
A solution that is
capable of screning
100% genetic diseases
left.content: If you are considering IVF treatment and would like more information about how genome screening with GenomeScreen®  could optimize your chances for success, please feel free to contact us. We are here to listen to your story with care, empathy and professional expertise, and help you navigate your path forward.

left.title:
How it works for Parents
Headline here
left.content: You’ve probably come across us on your road to building a happy, healthy family. Our experienced team of practitioners care about the well-being of new parents and are committed to supporting your goal of providing the best developmental environmentchance for you and your baby./nIt is every parent’s goal to secure a safe, healthy future for their family. In harmony with this natural desire GenEmbryomics hasve developed aour supportive and comprehensive approach to pre-implantation embryo screening to complement your current IVF treatment.

left.title: The Product
left.content: We have developed and pioneered the most innovative whole-genome sequencing embryonic screening test available today. What does this mean? Simply put, we work alongside your standard IVF therapy to provide detailed screening before embryonic transfer has been decided. Our tests are specifically searching for ANY inherited genetic mutations - these may be predicted due to the presence of certain genomes in parents OR the presence of unexpected mutations found in the embryo.

bot.title: Title A
bot.content: The screening process itself is simple and easy to arrange. Using the GenEmbryomics patient portal we can work with your doctor to arrange for a DNA sample collection to be sent to us.

bot.title: Title B
bot.content: Once it arrivesd at our state-of-the-art facilities, our team of professionals analyse the embryo genome sequence for any conditions or genetic mutations. The results are then compiled into a GenomeScreen summary which offers a detailed breakdown of the summary as well as guidance for the future health of your embryos.

bot.title: Title C
bot.content: Our evaluation is conducted and returned in a completely confidential and easy to understand report. GenEmbryomic’s sophisticated screening affords you with the best possible information you need to assess the most beneficial course of action for both parents and embryos. With the right information at your disposal you are in the bestperfect position to ensurework towards the welfare of a healthy baby.

right.content: WGS is indicated for any IVF patient but strongly recommended on couples with male partners above 40 years of age.

left.title: We’re listening!
left.content: We understand you may have many additional questions and would be very happy to talk through them with you.

left.title:
How it works for Clinics
Headline here
left.content:
Helping people realise their dream of growing a happy, healthy family is our passion. The team at GenEmbryomics is committed to supporting your efforts to make the very best decisions for your IVF patients.
Many standard IVF endorsed screening systems are effective at picking up predicted genetic abnormalities, based on a set of routine checks. However, they often do not have the capability to search for the presence of unexpected abnormalities or De novo SNP mutations. GenEmbryomics isare the industry’s leading developers of whole genome sequencing for IVF.

left.title: The GenomeScreen℠ Test
left.content: The GenomeScreen tests have a specificity and accuracy of 99.99% for inherited diseases. We are also able to detect 79% of De novo mutations. This pre-implantation screening is thorough enough to uncover the presence of genetic mutations which may result in future complications or inherited disease.

sections.title:  Simple to order. Simpler to assess. Even simpler to own.

bot.title: DNA Collected
bot.content: IVF Clinic collects the DNA samples from parent donors and the embryo trophectoderm cells and sends the samples to the lab

bot.title: DNA Sequenced
bot.content: Lab provides whole genome sequencing for the DNA samples and uploads the FASTQ files for each sample to the GenEmbryomics HIPAA comoliant cloud server

bot.title: Cloud Bioinformatics
bot.content:
Mapping sequences into a BAM file
Short variant calling
CNV calling
Repeat Expansion calling

bot.title: Clinical Report
bot.content: The test report is sent to IVI clinic for IVF doctor to inform patients about the genetic health of the embryo

bot.title: Variant Curation
bot.content: The data is curated by a variant curator and reported with a clinical geneticist.
GenEmbryomics equipment requires less than half the space
weighs more than a factor of 100 less, and is 50-70% less expensive to buy and maintain.
ROIs for hospitals will drop from >10 years to 3-4 years
